title: Park Kids

sunday_groups.heading: Sunday Kids Groups
paragraphs: Our Park Kids groups are for children aged 1-11 and run during our Sunday gathering at 10:45am.
Children start in the service with the church family and then move into age-appropriate groups for Bible teaching, prayer, and activities.

social_story.heading: Social Story for Visiting Church
social_story.intro: Here is a step-by-step guide for what happens when visiting St John's Park Church on a Sunday.
steps: When I arrive at St John's Park Church I will see a big blue open door with a ramp for wheelchair access.
I will go inside two sets of doors and then there will be someone at the back of church to say hello to me.
There will be ear defenders and activity bags for me to use if I want to. I am allowed to borrow them without asking.
The toilets are in the side hallway. There is also an accessible toilet and I am allowed to use it even if I don't have a disability.
In church I can sit on any of the available seats. If I have a wheelchair I am welcome to sit wherever I feel most comfortable.
When the service is ready to start, the person leading will say hello and tell us what is happening.
During the service we will sing songs. I can stand up or sit down to sing. It is OK to move around, dance or wave a flag.
After the Family Song, I will be invited to go into the side hall for kids activities. There is circle time, games, stories and a craft. It is OK to stay in the main service.
After the service I can stay for a drink and a biscuit and talk to people. If I don't want to do this, that is OK and I can go home with my family when we are ready.
